scope_of_article.type: Perspective review on polyelemental nanoparticles (PE NPs)
scope_of_article.definition: nanoparticles containing four or more elements in a single particle

SPBCL_multiphase_control.template: PEO-b-P2VP block copolymer nanoreactors patterned by dip-pen nanolithography
key_steps: patterning metal-salt-loaded polymer hemispheres on substrate
nucleation of many metal nanoparticles inside each nanoreactor
coarsening into a single PE nanoparticle
SPBCL_multiphase_control.design_principle: heterostructures minimize total surface and interfacial energy

carbothermal_shock_HEA.structure_outcome: single-crystalline FCC with homogeneous elemental distribution
carbothermal_shock_HEA.particle_size_control: tens of nanometers; reducible to few nanometers on defective carbon

electrochemical_shock_HEMG.electrolyte_format: water-in-oil emulsion droplets containing metal salts

forced_metal_exchange.strategy: stepwise metal exchange on preformed M29 nanoclusters

ammonia_oxidation_catalysis.comparison: conventional multiphase quinary NPs showed ~18.7% NOx selectivity

ammonia_decomposition.finding: ≈20× improvement in activity and stability vs Ru NPs and Co–Mo bimetallic NPs
ammonia_decomposition.key_parameter: Co/Mo molar ratio controls N adsorption energy
